{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3425379,"name":"","username":"ChocolateFreckle","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/chocolatefreckle/{size}/232350_2.png","created_at":"2024-09-19T22:42:23.262Z","cooked":"

We’ve been trying to invert our ‘IntakeFeedMotor’ in our ‘FrankenArm’ subsystem but have run into a lot of difficulty. Nothing we do seems to work. We’ve tried placing our current command in almost all spots in the FrankenArm subsystem and our Constants subsystem. We’ve also tried using different commands from past robots and online resources and haven’t been successful. Any advice?

Rummbly.Jr/src/main/java/frc/robot/FrankenArm.java at main · frc4087/Rummbly.Jr (github.com)

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":9,"updated_at":"2024-09-19T22:42:23.262Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":46,"reads":202,"readers_count":201,"score":270.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":471500,"topic_slug":"issues-with-inverting-one-of-our-motors","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://github.com/frc4087/Rummbly.Jr/blob/main/src/main/java/frc/robot/FrankenArm.java","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"Rummbly.Jr/src/main/java/frc/robot/FrankenArm.java at main · frc4087/Rummbly.Jr · GitHub","clicks":17}],"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":67840,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/issues-with-inverting-one-of-our-motors/471500/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true,"can_vote":false},{"id":3425381,"name":"Fletch","username":"Fletch1373","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/fletch1373/{size}/220073_2.png","created_at":"2024-09-19T23:00:32.523Z","cooked":"

Its not the question you asked, but…

Your subsystem (FrankenArm) should probabaly be moved under the subsystems folder/package.

Also, you shouldn’t have a joystick object or button bindings in it. Those should be moved to RobotContainer. You can either define those commands inline (like you currently are) in RobotContainer, or define them in FrankenArm as return values from functions (them have the button binding call the function).

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":9,"updated_at":"2024-09-19T23:00:32.523Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":190,"readers_count":189,"score":88.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":471500,"topic_slug":"issues-with-inverting-one-of-our-motors","display_username":"Fletch","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":3}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":9105,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"3181/3015 Mentor | 213/1373 Alum | CSA/FTAA/Jack-of-all-Trades"},"post_url":"/t/issues-with-inverting-one-of-our-motors/471500/2","custom_user_title":"3181/3015 Mentor | 213/1373 Alum | CSA/FTAA/Jack-of-all-Trades","reactions":[{"id":"point_up","type":"emoji","count":2},{"id":"+1","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":3,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3425405,"name":"Yishai Levy","username":"levyishai","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/levyishai/{size}/264719_2.png","created_at":"2024-09-20T00:44:09.496Z","cooked":"

What exactly do you mean by not working?
When using setInverted, does the motor keep going in the same direction?
If so, I’d make sure to firstly apply factory defaults to the motor, because it might’ve been changed before. And then, maybe the direction you want is actually inverted = false (counter clockwise positive). I’d highly recommend going through all the best practices as mentioned above, and mostly follow CTRE’s docs on configurations and things like that.

I’ve applied all of the best practices and agree it’s certainly helped some of our other functions(thank you!) however we’re still not able to invert our motors. We’ve checked our wiring and everything seems to be where it should be. Any other avenues to try?

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":9,"updated_at":"2024-09-21T17:09:04.053Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":91,"readers_count":90,"score":23.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":471500,"topic_slug":"issues-with-inverting-one-of-our-motors","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":67840,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/issues-with-inverting-one-of-our-motors/471500/4","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3425972,"name":"Yishai Levy","username":"levyishai","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/levyishai/{size}/264719_2.png","created_at":"2024-09-22T00:26:44.739Z","cooked":"

What specifically is the problem you’re experiencing, and why are you trying to invert the motors?
Is the problem that the motors only go in one direction? Should two motors face the same direction when given positive power, and that’s not happening? Are you just trying to invert for the sake of positive power = moving clockwise for code simplicity?

Either way, for most of these problems, inversion is not mandatory.
The only cases I can think of where inversion is really needed, is either when you have a follower and master system, or a remote encoder while trying to ensure the motor and the encoder are in the same direction for positive values. None of which seem to be the case by looking at your code, but maybe I’m missing something.

If you can, redefining your question with more detail might help.

We ended up manually inverting them on the CTRE Website and that worked.

","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"posts_count":9,"updated_at":"2024-09-23T23:53:41.781Z","reply_count":2,"reply_to_post_number":5,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":47,"readers_count":46,"score":34.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":471500,"topic_slug":"issues-with-inverting-one-of-our-motors","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":57809,"username":"levyishai","name":"Yishai Levy","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/levyishai/{size}/264719_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":67840,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/issues-with-inverting-one-of-our-motors/471500/6","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":true,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3426552,"name":"Yishai Levy","username":"levyishai","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/levyishai/{size}/264719_2.png","created_at":"2024-09-24T00:12:28.685Z","cooked":"

Happy to hear that!
I really advise configuring the motors via the configs in the code (which will operate exactly like configuring through the tuner), to make sure no previous settings are still on (with factory defaulting), and for a consistent code when switching motors or something similar. A good approach is that everything is configureable and happens from the code.
The way to do this is by following these docs, and better practice is not to call functions like setInverted, but rather apply that setting through a config.
Either way, good luck!

The setInverted call is entirely overriden by the motor output configuration that determines the direction of the motor, either CWPositive or CCWPositive.
